chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (P : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R), (forall u v : R, P u v) -> locally_2d P x y

Premises:
locally_2d = fun (P : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R) => exists delta : posreal, forall u v : R, Rabs (u - x) < delta -> Rabs (v - y) < delta -> P u v : (R -> R -> Prop) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
locally_2d_impl_strong : forall (P Q : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R), locally_2d (fun u v : R => locally_2d P u v -> Q u v) x y -> locally_2d P x y -> locally_2d Q x y
locally_2d_impl : forall (P Q : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R), locally_2d (fun u v : R => P u v -> Q u v) x y -> locally_2d P x y -> locally_2d Q x y
locally_2d_singleton : forall (P : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R), locally_2d P x y -> P x y
locally_2d_locally : forall (P : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R), locally_2d P x y < -> locally (x, y) (fun z : prod_UniformSpace R_UniformSpace R_UniformSpace => P (fst z) (snd z))
atan_sub_correct : forall u v : R, 1 + u * v <> 0 -> - PI / 2 < atan u - atan v < PI / 2 -> - PI / 2 < atan (atan_sub u v) < PI / 2 -> atan u = atan v + atan (atan_sub u v)
atan_sub = fun u v : R => (u - v) / (1 + u * v) : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
locally = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) (P : T -> Prop) => exists eps : posreal, forall y : T, ball x eps y -> P y : forall T : UniformSpace, T -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
locally_locally : forall (x : ?T) (P : ?T -> Prop), locally x P -> locally x (fun y : ?T => locally y P) where ?T : [ |- UniformSpace]
sigT_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (P0 : {x : A & P x} -> Type), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (existT P x p)) -> forall s : {x : A & P x}, P0 s
sigT_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (P0 : {x : A & P x} -> Prop), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (existT P x p)) -> forall s : {x : A & P x}, P0 s
locally_singleton : forall (x : ?T) (P : ?T -> Prop), locally x P -> P x where ?T : [ |- UniformSpace]
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
decide_left : forall (C : Prop) (decide : {C} + {~ C}), C -> forall P : {C} + {~ C} -> Prop, (forall H : C, P (left H)) -> P decide
Classical_Pred_Type.not_all_ex_not : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Prop), ~ (forall n : U, P n) -> exists n : U, ~ P n
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [ |- Type] ?F : [ |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [ |- Filter ?F]
mkfamily : forall (ind : R -> Prop) (f : R -> R -> Prop), (forall x : R, (exists y : R, f x y) -> ind x) -> family
Classical_Prop.imply_to_and : forall P Q : Prop, ~ (P -> Q) -> P /\ ~ Q
Classical_Pred_Type.not_ex_all_not : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Prop), ~ (exists n : U, P n) -> forall n : U, ~ P n
covering = fun (D : R -> Prop) (f0 : family) => forall x : R, D x -> exists y : R, f0 y x : (R -> Prop) -> family -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
cond_fam : forall (f0 : family) (x : R), (exists y : R, f0 x y) -> ind f0 x
filter_and : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, ?F P -> ?F Q -> ?F (fun x : ?T => P x /\ Q x) where ?T : [ |- Type] ?F : [ |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [ |- Filter ?F]
intersection_family = fun (f0 : family) (x : R) => forall y : R, ind f0 y -> f0 y x : family -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ R_scope]
derive_pt : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), derivable_pt f x -> R
derivable_pt_pow : forall (n : nat) (x : R), derivable_pt (fun y : R => y ^ n) x
Rmax_right : forall x y : R, x <= y -> Rmax x y = y
intersection_vide_in = fun (D : R -> Prop) (f0 : family) => forall x : R, (ind f0 x -> included (f0 x) D) /\ ~ (exists y : R, intersection_family f0 y) : (R -> Prop) -> family -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} For sig: Argument A is implicit For exist: Argument A is implicit For sig: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For exist: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ _]
Rmin_left : forall x y : R, x <= y -> Rmin x y = x
exp_inv : forall x y : R, exp x = exp y -> x = y
Rle_max_compat_l : forall x y z : R, x <= y -> Rmax z x <= Rmax z y
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0%nat => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
tan_minus : forall x y : R, cos x <> 0 -> cos y <> 0 -> cos (x - y) <> 0 -> 1 + tan x * tan y <> 0 -> tan (x - y) = (tan x - tan y) / (1 + tan x * tan y)
subfamily = fun (f0 : family) (D : R -> Prop) => {| ind := intersection_domain (ind f0) D; f := fun x y : R => f0 x y /\ D x; cond_fam := restriction_family f0 D |} : family -> (R -> Prop) -> family Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
Rmax = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then y else x : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rmin = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then x else y : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
derive_pt_pow : forall (n : nat) (x : R), derive_pt (fun y : R => y ^ n) x (derivable_pt_pow n x) = INR n * x ^ Init.Nat.pred n
Record family : Type := mkfamily { ind : R -> Prop; f : R -> R -> Prop; cond_fam : forall x : R, (exists y : R, f x y) -> ind x } For mkfamily: Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope function_scope]
constant_D_eq = fun (f : R -> R) (D : R -> Prop) (c : R) => forall x : R, D x -> f x = c : (R -> R) -> (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope]
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} For sigT: Argument A is implicit For existT: Argument A is implicit For sigT: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For existT: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ _]

```coq
intros P x y H. unfold locally_2d in *. 
apply locally_singleton. intros u v. apply locally_singleton.
exists (mkposreal (Rabs (u - x) / 2) (Rabs_pos (u - x) / 2)).
intros q H1 H2. apply H. 
Qed.
```

original: intros P x y H. unfold locally_2d in *. apply locally_singleton. intros u v. apply locally_singleton. exists (mkposreal (Rabs (u - x) / 2) (Rabs_pos (u - x) / 2)). intros q H1 H2. apply H.
